alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 3:41PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing near the Walker Creek burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following county, Okanogan. * WHEN...Until 500 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Rockslides, mudslides and debris flows. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 339 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Rockslides, mudslides and debris flows have been observed near Lightning Creek and Bonaparte Lake Road around 305 PM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bonaparte Lake Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
